website_summaries.verdict: Those who are seeking a comfortable leather boot for outdoor excursions may find satisfaction with this Merrell product. Indeed, its waterproofness, arch support, and minimal break-in period also score well with outdoor lovers.On the other hand, the hiker’s warmth may be a deal-breaker for some, especially those who value breathability during a trip. All in all, the Merrell Moab 2 Prime Mid Waterproof may be a compelling option to take outdoors, as long as weather conditions aren’t dry or humid.
pros: A huge percentage of Merrell Moab 2 Prime Mid Waterproof reviews from countless buyers confirm that it is a hiking boot with outstanding comfort
A majority of shoppers appreciate the effectiveness of its waterproof liner
Based on a bunch of consumer reports, the Moab 2 Prime Mid Waterproof’s arch support is impressive
A couple of adventurers laud the break-in period of this Merrell offering for being close to none
According to a handful of outdoor lovers, its outsole delivers ample surface grip
A minority of users laud the ankle support of this hiker
cons: Several wearers say that the Merrell Moab 2 Prime Mid Waterproof is not breathable
A few purchasers find it a bit heavy
Some customers mention that the hiking boot’s toe box is restrictive

customer_reviews.title: The top of the Merrell Moab 2 design, superior comfort, all-weather awesome boot ruggedness.
customer_reviews.text: Having tried on every available option I this style, this is by far the best of Merrell's Moab 2, in my opinion. Main reason is the all-leather upgrade on this new release. It adds a little more weight, but gives it more of a boot feel...where the others with mesh material feel more like high top hiking shoes. That said, this all-weather make is hotter to the foot and doesnt breathe quite as well. I recommend a cotton sock. If your foot sweats hard, these may not work for you unless it's really cold outside. All in all...I really like these - fantastic boots.
customer_reviews.author: Ann McGinnis

customer_reviews.title: Merrell quality is not what it used to be...
customer_reviews.text: At first I absolutely love these... A month later the sole is coming apart. I am extremely disappointed. Merrell is known for being a great product. I guess that's changing... Unfortunate.
customer_reviews.author: Danny

customer_reviews.title: Fell apart in less than 3.5 weeks
customer_reviews.text: My husband typically likes to wear Keen’s, but it was due time for a new pair and the last 3 pair of Keen’s fell apart in the same place within about 10 months use. These Merrell’s I purchased for him.. more expensive might I add than the Keen’s, we were both excited for them to arrive and try something new and we really hoped they’d last at least as long as the Keen’s. N.O.P.E.... they didn’t even last 3 weeks before the sides came apart. The rubber from the material. We are SO disappointed and want an immediate refund. Absolutely disappointed that we wasted our money. Trial and error I suppose. Big error. Will not be purchasing any more Merrell’s.
customer_reviews.author: Joanna

customer_reviews.title: Wet feet they don’t breathe
customer_reviews.text: They don’t breathe my feet were wet first day of use now after few days they stink,I guess I wasted $160
customer_reviews.author: Z

customer_reviews.title: Great Boot
customer_reviews.text: I have flat feet and bad arches but since receiving them i have worn them every day and my feet are feeling great, i walk between 2 to 5 miles a day and have had no issues with my feet. No break in required from the first time i put them on it was like they were made for me. One thing, i did size up 1 size account my normal shoe size my toes were just too close to the front of the boot for walking long distance and sure glad i did it.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn Davis

customer_reviews.title: Out of the box and straight to the Grand Canyon!
customer_reviews.text: Needed new hiking shoes. Wanted something more than the sneaker version of a hiking shoe. These boots not only look great, but they were the most comfortable fit of any shoe I've owned, straight out of the box. I wore them hiking in the Grand Canyon and they truly did not require breaking in. I did a long (7 hour, 10 mile, 6000 ft. elevation change) hike and my feet were no worse for wear at the end of the day. Love these boots.
customer_reviews.author: I Like Cake

customer_reviews.title: I wore them every day for three weeks on a European vacation
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely fantastic. It didn't matter if I was in a fancy restaurant or hiking through ruins they were very comfortable, lightweight, supportive, and beyond my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: chriis

customer_reviews.title: A WIDE THAT IS REALLY A WIDE
customer_reviews.text: Well made, very comfortable, true to size, nice looking. I have tried 2 different styles of Timberland hiking boots, and their "wide" is more like a medium. Keen boots are truly wide if designated that but run a half size small, but I cannot order a half size larger because I wear a 12 and they, like most brands, do not make a 12 1/2. I also purchased a pair of Merrell Moab 2 Ventilators for warmer weather and they are great also with the same fit. So for me, Merrell is the way to go for this type of footwear
customer_reviews.author: Frankly Speaking

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, sturdy, and pretty good looking boots
customer_reviews.text: These exceeded my expectations. Confortable out of the box. I ordered a half size up (like I do athletic shoes) to accomadate thick socks. My wife thinks they look pretty cool. Buy them.
customer_reviews.author: TVO

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable hiking boots
customer_reviews.text: These boots are very comfortable, solid, durable and well made.
customer_reviews.author: Jessy

customer_reviews.title: nice shoe,  will Reorder if they last 3 months.
customer_reviews.text: Seems able to last a few months I do Tree work climbing and go through lots of boots ,
customer_reviews.author: Travis Cook

customer_reviews.title: Last forever
customer_reviews.text: I am really hard on shoes and and Merrill’s take it. They fit great and break in good too. And the price is good here too
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Well made, well sized, well done.
customer_reviews.text: Unlike other brands, these fit. I know what size my foot is supposed to be and should not have to guess what size a manufacturer uses for that increment. Perfect fit, as always, as it should be. Very nice footwear as well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: High quality shoes
customer_reviews.text: High quality, comfortable and durable shoes. Perfect for mountain hiking. Matches the description.
customer_reviews.author: S.H.

customer_reviews.title: Best Boot I've Ever Bought!
customer_reviews.text: These boots are well worth the money that I spent. The PERFECT boot!
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: They have a nice grip and fit extremely well. I am still waiting to test out the water proofing.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Great fit and comfort.
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable,, you can wear these boots for a full day immediately after purchase. Second pair of Merrell boots and I’ll buy more in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Doug K

customer_reviews.title: Not Happy
customer_reviews.text: recd from amazon, they looked used. less than a month old and the stitching around the left shoes front is already coming apart!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Theodorski

customer_reviews.title: Great Boots.
customer_reviews.text: I love these boots. On my 3rd pair. There is almost no break in needed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Merrell fits and wears like a glove
customer_reviews.text: Love Merrell, wish they would not discontinue popular boots ie Mid Reflex hikers.
customer_reviews.author: Christian core

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I have been attempting to find an equivalent boot to replace my Siren Mid Leather hiking boots. (Can't believe Merrell stopped making those gems!) This boot fits the bill. I will feel confident hiking in any condition especially since the sole is the nice knobby rugged sort. Do not yet know whether they are truly waterproof or not, but I've been wearing Merrells for years with few problems regarding this issue. They fit well straight out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: Lab Geek

customer_reviews.title: Love my boots
customer_reviews.text: I love these boots. They fit perfectly, give my toes plenty of room, and look great, feel great. They provide a cushioned feel & support.
customer_reviews.author: p. johnson

customer_reviews.title: All Leather
customer_reviews.text: I walk hard.! LoL these boots have really awesome arch/bed support but the toe leather is thin and so I get to kick less $^**t than I would like... by no means a serious hiking boot with the thin leather at the toe specifically. BUT they have support and have become my "town" shoes!
customer_reviews.author: guinea pig

customer_reviews.title: SIZE UP A HALF A SIZE
customer_reviews.text: Although I didn't end of receiving these from amazon my money was retuned and I was able to buy them from the store. Size up! From my research I read everywhere to do this and I'm ALWAYS a 7, I ended up with a 7.5 and they fit perfect, great shoe so far.
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Best Hiking Shoes Ever
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of this type of shoe. No break in needed, trail ready out of the box. Hiked 30 miles with no blisters or discomfort. These are by far my favorite shoes on and off the trail.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Best Hiking Boot I’ve purchased.
customer_reviews.text: I really like these boots so much that when it appeared that they are discontinuing these I purchased a second pair. Got a great price on them too.
customer_reviews.author: Tigerlily

customer_reviews.title: SO COMFORTABLE
customer_reviews.text: As soon as I put these on I was absolutely in love with how comfortable they are. Seriously, it's like they were prescription shoes. Unfortunately they were too big so I returned them.
customer_reviews.author: Ana

customer_reviews.title: Good shoe
customer_reviews.text: Fit and quality as expected. Will order again when these wear out.
customer_reviews.author: Bilbirk

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love them! They fit great and feel comfortable. Can’t wait to take them out on a hike.
customer_reviews.author: Kristina McComas

customer_reviews.title: This is the good shoe I expected. very comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: This is the good shoe I expected. very comfortable. Hope to have enough durability. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Wayland T.

product_meta.title: Merrell mens J99739 Moab 2 Prime Mid Waterproof
product_meta.description: The Merrell® Moab 2 Prime Mid Waterproof hiking boot offers superior protection, underfoot support, and reliable grip to make sure you get the most out of every trail adventure Waterproof full grain leather upper with suede tongue and collar. Mid-cut height for added ankle support. M Select™ DRY technology seals out water while allowing moisture to escape. Bellows tongue helps keep debris out. Lace-up closure. Protective rubber toe cap. Heel pull loop. Breathable mesh lining offers a great in-shoe feel. Removable Kinetic Fit™ BASE contoured footbed for flexible support and underfoot cushioned comfort. Compression-molded EVA midsole for stability, underfoot comfort, and shock absorption. Molded nylon arch shank adds support. Merrell air cushioning in the heel absorbs impacting shock and helps stabilize the foot. Vibram® TC5+ outsole delivers high-performance durability, stability, and traction. 5 mm lug depth. Imported. Measurements: Heel Height: 1 1⁄4 in Weight: 1 lb 6 oz Shaft: 5 in Product measurements were taken using size 11, width M. Please note that measurements may vary by size. Weight of footwear is based on a single item, not a pair.
feature_bullets: Waterproof membrane seals out water and lets moisture escape, Waterproof full grain leather upper
Metal hook traditional lace closure, Bellows tongue keeps out debris, Protective toe cap, Breathable mesh lining
